original: JOHANSSON, Einar Leornard, Fabrikör, Sala, f Möklinta, Västm l, 16/8 98 av fabr L J o Johanna Andersson, gm Karin Nordin. Bergslag verkmäst- o tekn.sk. Verkmäst i fad smides- o vagnfabr.rör 18, eg fma, Einar Johanssons Bil & Mek verkst, Sala, sed. 26. Stdsflm, beredn.utsk, ordf Sala luftsk.nmd, Sala stads yrkessk, v. ordf el- o vattenvkt, led folksk.styr, arbetslösh.komm. Led Bil-verkst Riksfrbs centralstyr o ds vkst utsk, ordf Västml Bilverkst.frn. Odd Fellow, Tempelriddare.
translated: JOHANSSON, Einar Leonard, Industrialist, Sala, born in Möklinta, Västmanland County, on August 16, 1898 to factory owner L.J. and Johanna Andersson. Married to Karin Nordin. Foreman and technical school graduate in the Bergslagen region. Worked as a foreman in his father's forging and carriage factory until 1918, when he started his own company, Einar Johansson's Car & Mechanical Workshop, in Sala. Member of the City Film Committee, preparatory committee, and chairman of the Sala Air School Committee and the Sala City Vocational School. Vice Chairman of the Electrical and Water Inspection Board. Member of the local school board and the unemployment committee. Member of the Central Board of the National Association of Car Workshops and its growth committee. Chairman of the Western Sweden Association of Car Workshops. Member of the Odd Fellows and the Templar Knights.

structured.name: Einar Leonard Johansson
structured.description: Einar Leornard Johansson was an industrialist from Sala. He was born on August 16, 1898, in Möklinta, Västmanland County. He was the son of factory owner L.J. Johansson and Johanna Andersson. He married Karin Nordin.

affiliation.name: Central Board of the National Association of Car Workshops
Western Sweden Association of Car Workshops
